displayname: Global retention policy for messages (Data Retention)
description: Set how long Mattermost keeps messages across all teams and channels. Doesn't apply to custom retention policies. The minimum time is one day.

displayname: Global retention policy for files (Data Retention)
description: Set how long Mattermost keeps files across all teams and channels. Doesn't apply to custom retention policies. The minimum time is one day.
Set the start time of the daily scheduled data retention job. Must be a 24-hour time stamp in the form HH:MM. This setting is based on the local time of the server.

• true: Mattermost will generate a compliance export file that contains all messages that were posted in the last 24 hours.
  • false: (Default) Mattermost doesn't generate a compliance export file.
Set the start time of the daily scheduled compliance export job. Must be a 24-hour time stamp in the form HH:MM. This setting is based on the local time of the server.
File format of the compliance export. Currently supported formats are CSV, Actiance XML, and Global Relay EML.

displayname: Global Relay customer account (Compliance Export - Global Relay EML)
description: Type of Global Relay customer account your organization has, either A9/Type 9 or A10/Type 10.

displayname: Global Relay SMTP username (Compliance Export - Global Relay EML)
description: The username for authenticating to the Global Relay SMTP server.

displayname: Global Relay SMTP password (Compliance Export - Global Relay EML)
description: The password associated with the Global Relay SMTP username.
The email address your Global Relay server monitors for incoming compliance exports.

• true: Compliance reporting is enabled in Mattermost.
  • false: (Default) Compliance reporting is disabled.
Sets the directory where compliance reports are written. The default value is ./data/.

• true: Mattermost generates a daily compliance report.
  • false: (Default) Daily reports are not generated.
Set the size of the batches in which posts will be read from the database to generate the compliance report. The default value is 30000.

displayname: Enable custom terms of service (Custom Terms of Service)
description:
• True: New users must accept the Terms of Service before accessing any Mattermost teams on desktop, web, or mobile. Existing users must accept them after login or a page refresh.
  • False: During account creation or login, users can review Terms of Service by accessing the link configured via System Console > Legal and Support > Terms of Service link.

displayname: Custom terms of service text (Custom Terms of Service)
description: Text that will appear in your custom Terms of Service. Supports Markdown-formatted text.
The number of days before Terms of Service acceptance expires, and the terms must be re-accepted. The default value is 365. A value of 0 indicates the terms do not expire.

• true: (Default) New accounts can be created by an email invitation or a public team invitation link.
  • false: Disables new account creation. Attempting to create an account through an existing email or link displays an error message.

displayname: Restrict account creation to specified email domains (Signup)
description:
This setting limits the email address domains that can be used to create a new account or team. You must set Require Email Verification to true for the restriction to function. This setting only affects email login.

String input of a comma-separated list of domains, i.e. corp.mattermost.com, mattermost.com

• true: Users can create accounts on the server without an invitation.
  • false: (Default) Users must have an invitation to create an account on the server.

• true: Allows users to send email invitations.
  • false: (Default) Disables email invitations.

• true: (Default) Allows creation of team and user accounts with email and password.
  • false: Disables creation of team and user accounts with email and password. This requires a single sign-on service to create accounts.

• true: Requires email verification for new accounts before allowing the user to sign-in.
  • false: (Default) Disables email verification. This can be used to speed development by skipping the verification process.

• true: (Default) Allows users to sign-in with email and password.
  • false: Disables authentication with email and password, and removes the option from the login screen. Use this option to limit authentication to single sign-on services.

• true: (Default) Allows authentication with a username and password for accounts created with an email address. This setting does not affect AD/LDAP sign-in.
  • false: Disables authenticaton with a username and removes the option from the login screen.
This setting determines the minimum number of characters in passwords. It must be a whole number greater than or equal to 5 and less than or equal to 64. Default is 5.

displayname: Password requirements - At least one lowercase letter (Password)
description: This setting controls password character requirements. When true, passwords must contain at least one lowercase letter. Default is false.

displayname: Password requirements - At least one uppercase letter (Password)
description: This setting controls password character requirements. When true, passwords must contain at least one uppercase letter. Default is false.

displayname: Password requirements - At least one number (Password)
description: This setting controls password character requirements. When true, passwords must contain at least one number. Default is false.

displayname: Password requirements - At least one symbol (Password)
description: This setting controls password character requirements. When true, passwords must contain at least one symbol from !"#$%&'()*+,-./:;<=>?@[]^_`|~. Default is false.
This setting determines the number of failed sign-in attempts a user can make before being locked out and required to go through a password reset by email. Default is 10.

Show or hide the Forgot Password link on the Mattermost login page.

  • true: (Default) Displays the Forgot Password link on the Mattermost login page.
  • false: Hides the Forgot Password link from the Mattermost login page.

• true: Users who sign-in with AD/LDAP or an email address have the option to add multi-factor authentication to their accounts.
  • false: (Default) Disables multi-factor authentication.

• true: Requires multi-factor authentication (MFA) for users who sign-in with AD/LDAP or an email address. New users must configure MFA. Logged in users are redirected to the MFA setup page until configuration is complete.
  • false: MFA is optional.

• true: Allows sign-in with AD/LDAP or Active Directory.
  • false: (Default) Disables sign-in with AD/LDAP or Active Directory.

• true: Mattermost periodically syncs users from AD/LDAP.
  • false: (Default) Disables AD/LDAP synchronization.
This setting will display placeholder text in the login field of the sign-in page. This text can remind users to sign-in with their AD/LDAP credentials. Default is AD/LDAP Username.
This is the domain name or IP address of the AD/LDAP server.
This is the port Mattermost uses to connect to the AD/LDAP server. Default is 389.

This setting controls the type of security Mattermost uses to connect to the AD/LDAP server, with these options:

  • none: (Default) No encryption. With this option, it is highly recommended that the connection be secured outside of Mattermost, such as by a stunnel proxy.
  • TLS: Encrypts communication with TLS.
  • STARTTLS: Attempts to upgrade an existing insecure connection to a secure connection with TLS.

• true: Disables the certificate verification step for TLS and STARTTLS connections. Use this option for testing. Do not use this option when TLS is required in production.
  • false: (Default) Enables certification verification.
Use this setting to upload the private key file from your LDAP authentication provider, if TLS client certificates are the primary authentication mechanism.
Use this setting to upload the public TLS certificate from your LDAP authentication provider, if TLS client certificates are the primary authentication mechanism.

This is the username for the account Mattermost utilizes to perform an AD/LDAP search. This should be an account specific to Mattermost.

Limit the permissions of the account to read-only access to the portion of the AD/LDAP tree specified in the Base DN setting.

When using Active Directory, Bind Username should specify domain in "DOMAIN/username" format.
This is the password for the username given in the Bind Username setting.
This is the Base Distinguished Name of the location in the AD/LDAP tree where Mattermost will start searching for users.
This setting accepts a general syntax AD/LDAP filter that is applied when searching for user objects. Only the users selected by the query can access Mattermost.
This setting accepts a general syntax AD/LDAP filter that is applied when searching for group objects. Only the groups selected by the query can access Mattermost.

• true: Enables the Admin Filter setting that designates System Admins using an AD/LDAP filter.
  • false: (Default) Disables the Admin Filter setting.
This setting accepts an AD/LDAP filter that designates the selected users as System Admins. Users are promoted to this role on their next sign-in or on the next scheduled AD/LDAP sync.
This setting accepts an AD/LDAP filter to apply when searching for external users with Guest Access to Mattermost. Only users selected by the query can access Mattermost as Guests.
This is the attribute in the AD/LDAP server that is serves as a unique user identifier in Mattermost. The attribute should have a unique value that does not change, such as objectGUID or entryUUID.
This is the attribute in the AD/LDAP server that is used for signing-in to Mattermost. This is normally the same as the Username Attribute.
This is the attribute in the AD/LDAP server that populates the username field in Mattermost. This is normally the same as the Login ID Attribute, but it can be mapped to a different attribute.
This is the attribute in AD/LDAP server that populates the email address field in Mattermost. Email notifications are sent to this address.
This is the attribute in the AD/LDAP server that populates the first name field in Mattermost. When set, users cannot edit their first name.
This is the attribute in the AD/LDAP server that populates the last name field in Mattermost. When set, users cannot edit their last name.
This is the attribute in the AD/LDAP server that populates the nickname field in Mattermost. When set, users cannot edit their nickname.
This is the attribute in the AD/LDAP server that populates the position field in Mattermost. When set, users cannot edit their position.
This is the attribute in the AD/LDAP server that syncs and locks the profile picture in Mattermost. The image is updated when users sign-in, not when Mattermost syncs with the AD/LDAP server.
This is the AD/LDAP Group Display name attribute that populates the Mattermost group name field.
This is an AD/LDAP Group ID attribute that sets a unique identifier for groups. This should be a value that does not change, such as entryUUID or objectGUID.
This value determines how often Mattermost syncs with the AD/LDAP server by setting the number of minutes between each sync. Default is 60.
This setting paginates the results of AD/LDAP server queries. Use this setting if your AD/LDAP server has a page size limit. A page size of 0 disables pagination of results. Default is 0.
This setting determines the timeout period, in seconds, for AD/LDAP queries. Default is 60.

• true: Enables sign-in with SAML. See SAML Single Sign-On to learn more.
  • false: (Default) Disables sign-in with SAML.

displayname: Enable synchronizing SAML accounts with AD/LDAP (SAML)
description:
• true: Mattermost updates configured Mattermost user attributes (ex. FirstName, Position, Email) with their values from AD/LDAP.
  • false: (Default) Disables syncing of SAML-authenticated Mattermost users with AD/LDAP.

displayname: Ignore guest users when synchronizing with AD/LDAP (SAML)
description:
• true: When syncing with the AD/LDAP server, Mattermost does not sync any information about SAML-authenticated Guest Users from the AD/LDAP server.
  • false: (Default) Syncing Mattermost with the AD/LDAP server updates Guest User attributes and deactivates and removes SAML-authenticated accounts for Guest Users that are no longer active on the AD/LDAP server.

displayname: Override SAML bind data with AD/LDAP information (SAML)
description:
• true: If the SAML ID attribute is configured, Mattermost overrides the SAML ID attribute with the AD/LDAP ID attribute.
  • false: (Default) Mattermost uses the email attribute to bind users to SAML.
This setting is the URL from which Mattermost requests setup metadata from the provider.
This setting is the URL where Mattermost sends a SAML request to start the login sequence.
This setting is the issuer URL for the Identity Provider for SAML requests.
The public authentication certificate issued by your Identity Provider.

• true: (Default) Mattermost checks that the SAML Response signature matches the Service Provider Login URL.
  • false: The signature is not verified. This is not recommended for production. Use this option for testing only.
Enter the URL of your Mattermost server, followed by /login/sso/saml, i.e. https://example.com/login/sso/saml. This setting is also known as the Assertion Consumer Service URL.
This setting is the unique identifier for the Service Provider, which in most cases is the same as the Service Provider Login URL. In ADFS, this must match the Relying Party Identifier.

• true: (Default) Mattermost will decrypt SAML Assertions that are encrypted with your Service Provider Public Certificate.
  • false: Mattermost does not decrypt SAML Assertions. Use this option for testing only. It is not recommended for production.
This setting stores the private key used to decrypt SAML Assertions from the Identity Provider.
This setting stores the certificate file used to sign a SAML request to the Identity Provider for a SAML login when Mattermost is initiating the login as the Service Provider.

• true: Mattermost signs the SAML request with the Service Provider Private Key.
  • false: Mattermost does not sign the SAML request.
This setting determines the signature algorithm used to sign the SAML request. Options are: RSAwithSHA1, RSAwithSHA256, RSAwithSHA512.

This setting determines the canonicalization algorithm. With these options: - Canonical1.0 (Default) for Exclusive XML Canonicalization 1.0 (omit comments) (http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#) - Canonical1.1 for Canonical XML 1.1 (omit comments) (http://www.w3.org/2006/12/xml-c14n11)
This setting determines the attribute from the SAML Assertion that populates the user email address field in Mattermost.
This setting determines the SAML Assertion attribute that populates the username field in the Mattermost UI.
(Optional) This setting determines the SAML Assertion attribute used to bind users from SAML to users in Mattermost.
(Optional) This setting determines the SAML Assertion attribute used to apply a Guest role to users in Mattermost.

• true: System Admin status is determined by the SAML Assertion attribute set in Admin attribute.
  • false: (Default) System Admin status is not determined by the SAML Assertion attribute
(Optional) This setting determines the attribute in the SAML Assertion for designating System Admins.
(Optional) This setting determines the SAML Assertion attribute that populates the first name of users in Mattermost.
(Optional) This setting determines the SAML Assertion attribute that populates the last name of users in Mattermost.
(Optional) This setting determines the SAML Assertion attribute that populates the nickname of users in Mattermost.
(Optional) This setting determines the SAML Assertion attribute that populates the position (job title or role at company) of users in Mattermost.
(Optional) This setting determines the SAML Assertion attribute that populates the language preference of users in Mattermost.
(Optional) The text that appears in the login button on the login page. Default is SAML.
Use this setting to enable OAuth and specify the service provider.

displayname: Enable OAuth 2.0 authentication with GitLab (OAuth - GitLab)
description:
• true: Allows team and account creation using GitLab OAuth authentication. Input the Secret and ID credentials to configure.
  • false: (Default) Disables GitLab OAuth authentication.
This setting holds the OAuth Application ID from GitLab.

displayname: GitLab OAuth 2.0 Application secret key (OAuth - GitLab)
description: This setting holds the OAuth Application Secret Key from GitLab.
This setting holds the URL of your GitLab instance, e.g. https://example.com:3000.

displayname: GitLab OAuth 2.0 User API endpoint (OAuth - GitLab)
description: This setting holds the URL of your GitLab User API endpoint, e.g. https://<your-gitlab-url>/api/v3/user.
This setting holds the URL of your GitLab Auth endpoint, e.g. https://<your-gitlab-url>/oauth/authorize.
This setting holds the URL of your GitLab OAuth Token endpoint, e.g. https://<your-gitlab-url>/oauth/token.

displayname: Enable OAuth 2.0 authentication with Google (OAuth - Google)
description:
• true: Allows team and account creation using Google OAuth authentication.
  • false: (Default) Disables Google OAuth authentication.
This setting stores the OAuth Client ID from Google.
This setting stores the OAuth Client Secret from Google. The Secret is generated at the same time as the Client ID.

displayname: Google OAuth 2.0 User API endpoint (OAuth - Google)
description: We recommend https://people.googleapis.com/v1/people/me?personFields=names,emailAddresses,nicknames,metadata as the User API Endpoint.
We recommend https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/v2/auth as the Auth Endpoint.
We recommend https://www.googleapis.com/oauth2/v4/token as the Token Endpoint.

• true: Allow team creation and account signup using Office 365 OAuth.
  • false: (Default) Office 365 OAuth cannot be used for team creation or account signup.
This setting holds the Application ID generated when configuring Office 365 as a Single Sign-On service through the Microsoft Azure Portal.
This setting holds the Application Secret Password generated when configuring Office 365 as a Single Sign-On service through the Microsoft Azure Portal.
This setting holds the Directory (tenant) ID set for Mattermost through the Azure Portal.
We recommend using https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/me as the User API Endpoint. It is the default value.
We recommend https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/oauth2/v2.0/authorize as the Auth Endpoint.
We recommend that you use https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/oauth2/v2.0/token as the Token Endpoint. It is the default value.

displayname: Select OpenID Connect service provider (OpenID Connect)
description: Choose whether OpenID Connect can be used for account creation and login.
Specify the URL of your GitLab instance (example https://example.com:3000).
Obtain this value by registering Mattermost as an application in your service provider account.
Obtain this value by registering Mattermost as an application in your service provider account.
Obtain this value by registering Mattermost as an application in your service provider account.

• true: Allow team creation and account signup using Google OpenID Connect.
  • false: (Default) Google OpenID Connect cannot be used for team creation or account signup.
This value is prepopulated with https://accounts.google.com/.well-known/openid-configuration.
Obtain this value by registering Mattermost as an application in your Google account.
Obtain this value by registering Mattermost as an application in your Google account.

• true: Allow team creation and account signup using Office 365 OpenID Connect.
  • false: (Default) Office 365 OpenID Connect cannot be used for team creation or account signup.
This setting holds the Directory (tenant) ID set for Mattermost through the Microsoft Azure Portal.
This value is prepopulated with https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/v2.0/.well-known/openid-configuration.
This setting stores the Application (client) ID generated through the Microsoft Azure Portal.
This setting stores the Client Secret generated through the Microsoft Azure Portal.

• True: Allow team creation and account signup using OpenID Connect.
  • False: (Default) OpenID Connect cannot be used for team creation or account signup.
Specify the text that displays on the OpenID login button.
Specify the color of the OpenID login button for white labeling purposes. Use a hex code with a #-sign before the code, for example #145DBF.
Obtain this value by registering Mattermost as an application in your service provider account.
Obtain this value by registering Mattermost as an application in your service provider account.
Obtain this value by registering Mattermost as an application in your service provider account.

• true: Enables the guest account feature.
  • false: (Default) Disables the guest account feature.
When populated, guest accounts can only be created by a verified email from this list of comma-separated domains.

• True: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is required for login.
  • False: (Default) Multi-factor authentication for guests is optional.

• True: (Default) Guest tags are visible in Mattermost.
  • False: (Default) Guest tags aren't visible in Mattermost.
The URL that users use to access Mattermost. The port number is required if it’s not a standard port, such as 80 or 443.
The address and port to which to bind and listen. Specifying :8065 will bind to all network interfaces. Specifying 127.0.0.1:8065 will only bind to the network interface having that IP address.

• true: Forwards all insecure traffic from port 80 to secure port 443.
  • false: (Default) When using a proxy such as NGINX in front of Mattermost this setting is unnecessary and should be set to false.

Connection security between Mattermost clients and the server.

  • Not specified: Mattermost will connect over an unsecure connection.
  • TLS: Encrypts the communication between Mattermost clients and your server.
The path to the certificate file to use for TLS connection security.
The path to the TLS key file to use for TLS connection security.

Enable the automatic retrieval of certificates from Let’s Encrypt.

  • true: The certificate will be retrieved when a client attempts to connect from a new domain. This will work with multiple domains.
  • false: (Default) Manual certificate specification based on the TLS Certificate File and TLS Key File specified above.

displayname: Let's Encrypt certificate cache file (Web Server)
description: The path to the file where certificates and other data about the Let’s Encrypt service will be stored.
Maximum time allowed from when the connection is accepted to when the request body is fully read. Default is 300 seconds.

If using HTTP (insecure), this is the maximum time, in seconds, allowed from the end of reading the request headers until the response is written. If using HTTPS, it's the total time, in seconds, from when the connection is accepted until the response is written. Default is 300 seconds.
This is the maximum time, in seconds, allowed before an idle connection is disconnected. Default is 300 seconds.

• gzip: (Default) The Mattermost server will serve static files compressed with gzip to improve performance.
  • Uncompressed: The Mattermost server will serve static files uncompressed.
  • Disabled: The Mattermost server will not serve static files.

• true: Outgoing HTTPS requests, including S3 clients, can accept unverified, self-signed certificates.
  • false: (Default) Only secure HTTPS requests are allowed.
A comma-separated list of paths within the Mattermost domain that are managed by a third party service instead of Mattermost itself.
You can configure the server to instruct clients on where they should try to connect websockets to.
The path and filename of the license file on disk.
The minimum TLS version used by the Mattermost server. Default value is 1.2.
Specified headers that will be checked, one by one, for IP addresses (order is important). All other headers are ignored.

• true: Adds the Strict Transport Security (HSTS) header to all responses, forcing the browser to request all resources via HTTPS.
  • false: (Default) No restrictions on TLS transport. Strict Transport Security (HSTS) header isn't added to responses.
The time, in seconds, that the browser remembers a site is only to be accessed using HTTPS. Default is 63072000 seconds (2 years).
Set TLS ciphers overwrites to meet requirements from legacy clients which don't support modern ciphers, or to limit the types of accepted ciphers.
Set a threshold on the number of goroutines when the Mattermost system is considered to be in a healthy state. Default is -1 which turns off checking for the threshold.

• true: (Default) Allows cookies for subdomains by setting the domain parameter on Mattermost cookies.
  • false: Cookies not allowed for subdomains.
Define the frequency, in milliseconds, of cluster request time logging for performance monitoring. Default is 2000 milliseconds (2 seconds).
The type of database. Either postgres or mysql. The default value is mysql.
The connection string to the master database.
The maximum number of idle connections held open to the database. Default is 10.
The maximum number of idle connections held open to the database. Default is 300.
The amount of time to wait, in seconds, for a response from the database after opening a connection and sending the query. Default is 30 seconds.
Maximum lifetime for a connection to the database, in milliseconds. Default is 3600000 milliseconds (1 hour).
Maximum time a database connection can remain idle, in milliseconds. Default is 300000 milliseconds (5 minutes).
Minimum number of characters in a hashtag. This value must be greater than or equal to 2. Default is 3.

• true: Executing SQL statements are written to the log.
  • false: (Default) SQL statements aren't written to the log.

• true: Disables the use of the database to perform searches. If another search engine isn't configured, setting this value to true will result in empty search results.
  • false: (Default) Database search isn't disabled.
Read-only display of the currently active backend used for search.
Specifies the connection strings for the read replica databases.
Specifies the connection strings for the search replica databases. A search replica is similar to a read replica, but is used only for handling search queries.
Specifies a connection string and user-defined SQL queries on the database to measure replica lag for a single replica instance.
Specifies how frequently unhealthy replicas will be monitored for liveness check. Mattermost will dynamically choose a replica if it's alive.

Configure Mattermost to index new posts automatically.

  • true: Indexing of new posts occurs automatically.
  • false: (Default) Elasticsearch indexing is disabled and new posts are not indexed.
The address of the Elasticsearch server.
Optional path to the Custom Certificate Authority certificates for the Elasticsearch server.
Optional client certificate for the connection to the Elasticsearch server in PEM format.
Optional key for the client certificate in PEM format.

The certificate step for TLS connections can be skipped.

  • true: Skips the certificate verification step for TLS connections.
  • false: (Default) Mattermost does not skip certificate verification.
(Optional) The username to authenticate to the Elasticsearch server.
(Optional) The password to authenticate to the Elasticsearch server.

Configure Mattermost to automatically find and connect to all data nodes in a cluster.

  • true: Sniffing finds and connects to all data nodes in your cluster automatically.
  • false: (Default) Cluster sniffing is disabled.
Configure Mattermost to start a bulk index of all existing posts in the database by selecting Index Now.
Specify index names to ignore while purging indexes, separated by commas.
Purge the entire Elasticsearch index by selecting Purge Indexes.

Configure Mattermost to use Elasticsearch for all search queries using the latest index.

  • true: Elasticsearch will be used for all search queries using the latest index. Search results may be incomplete until a bulk index of the existing post database is finished.
  • false: (Default) Database search is used for search queries.

Configure Mattermost to use Elasticsearch for all autocompletion queries on users and channels using the latest index.

  • true: Elasticsearch will be used for all autocompletion queries on users and channels using the latest index.
  • false: (Default) Database autocomplete is used.
The number of replicas to use for each post index. Default is 1.
The number of shards to use for each post index. Default is 1.
The number of replicas to use for each channel index. Default is 1.
The number of shards to use for each channel index. Default is 1.
The number of replicas to use for each user index. Default is 1.
The number of shards to use for each user index. Default is 1.
Elasticsearch indexes older than the age specified by this setting, in days, will be aggregated during the daily scheduled job. Default is 365 days.
The start time of the daily scheduled aggregator job. Must be a 24-hour time stamp in the form HH:MM based on the local time of the server. Default is 03:00 (3 AM).
The prefix added to the Elasticsearch index name.
The number of new posts batched together before they're added to the Elasticsearch index. Default is 1.

The maximum time window, in seconds, for a batch of posts being indexed by the Bulk Indexer. This setting serves as a performance optimization for installs with over ~10 million posts in the database. Default is 3600 seconds (1 hour).
The timeout, in seconds, for Elasticsearch calls. Default is 30 seconds.

Options for printing Elasticsearch trace errors.

  • error: Creates the error trace when initializing the Elasticsearch client and prints any template creation or search query that returns an error as part of the error message.
  • all: Creates the three traces (error, trace and info) for the driver and doesn’t print the queries because they will be part of the trace log level of the driver.
  • not specified: (Default) No error trace is created.

The type of file storage system used.

  • local: (Default) Files and images are stored in the specified local file directory.
  • amazons3: Files and images are stored on Amazon S3 based on the access key, bucket, and region fields provided.
The local directory to which files are written when the File storage system is set to local. Default value is ./data/.
The maximum file size, in bytes, for message attachments. Default value is 104857600 bytes (1 megabyte).

displayname: Enable document search by content (File Storage)
description:
Enable users to search the contents of documents attached to messages.

  • true: (Default) Documents are searchable by their content.
  • false: Documents aren’t searchable by their content.

displayname: Enable searching content of documents within ZIP files (File Storage)
description:
Enables users to search the contents of compressed ZIP files attached to messages.

  • true: Contents of documents within ZIP files are returned in search results.
  • false: (Default) The contents of documents within ZIP files aren’t returned in search results.
The name of the bucket for your S3-compatible object storage instance.
The prefix you selected for your Amazon S3 bucket in AWS.
The AWS region you selected when creating your Amazon S3 bucket in AWS. For MinIO or Digital Ocean Spaces, leave this setting empty.

displayname: Amazon S3 access key ID (File Storage)
description: A string with the access key for the S3-compatible storage instance.
The hostname of your S3-compatible instance. Default value is s3.amazonaws.com.

displayname: Amazon S3 secret access key (File Storage)
description: The secret access key associated with your Amazon S3 Access Key ID.

displayname: Enable secure Amazon S3 connections (File Storage)
description: Enable or disable secure Amazon S3 connections. Default value is true.

• true: Use Signature v2 signing process.
  • false: (Default) Use Signature v4 signing process.

displayname: Enable server-side encryption for Amazon S3 (File Storage)
description:
• true: Encrypts files in Amazon S3 using server-side encryption with Amazon S3-managed keys.
  • false: (Default) Doesn’t encrypt files in Amazon S3.

• true: Log additional debugging information is logged to the system logs.
  • false: (Default) No Amazon S3 debugging information is included in the system logs.
The font used in auto-generated profile pictures with colored backgrounds and username initials. Default value is nunito-bold.ttf.
Amount of time, in milliseconds, before requests to Amazon S3 time out. Default value is 30000 (30 seconds).

• true: (Default) Enables an image proxy for loading external images.
  • false: Disables the image proxy.

The type of image proxy used by Mattermost.

  • local: (Default) The Mattermost server itself acts as the image proxy.
  • atmos/camo: An external atmos/camo image proxy is used.
The URL of the atmos/camo proxy.
The URL signing key passed to an atmos/camo image proxy.
The location of the SMTP email server used for email notifications.
The port of SMTP email server.

• true: SMTP username and password are used for authenticating to the SMTP server.
  • false: (Default) Mattermost doesn’t attempt to authenticate to the SMTP server.

• true: Only an account administrator must log in. The rest of the users will use their e-mail to log in.
  • false: (Default) All users must use their e-mail to log in.
Specify the Client ID for the OAuth app registered with Zoom. Leave blank if not using OAuth.
Specify the Client Secret for the OAuth app registered with Zoom. Leave blank if not using OAuth.

displayname: At rest token encryption key (Plugins - Zoom)
description: Generate an AES encryption key for the Zoom OAuth Token used to encrypt stored access tokens by selecting Regenerate.
Specify the API Key generated by Zoom used to create meetings and pull user data.
Specify the API Secret generated by Zoom for your API key.
Generate a secret for the webhook URL endpoint used to authenticate the webhook to Mattermost.
In addition to the Mattermost plugin signing key built into the server, each public key specified is trusted to validate plugin signatures.
Specify the Chimera URL used by Mattermost plugins to connect with pre-created OAuth applications.
Name of the site shown in login screens and user interface. Default value is Mattermost.
Text displayed above the login form. When not specified, the phrase Log in is displayed.

• true: Enables the display of a custom image and text on the login page
  • false: (Default) Custom branding is disabled
A JPG image for display on the login page. The image must be uploaded through the System Console. The file should be smaller than 2 MB.
Text that will be shown below the Custom brand image on the login page. Maximum 500 characters.

• true: (Default) A link to the Mattermost Community appears as Ask the community under the Help menu in the channel header.
  • false: The link does not appear.

This field sets the URL for the Help link on the login and sign-up pages, as well as the Help Resources link under the Help menu in the channel header. If this field is empty, those links do not appear. Default value is https://about.mattermost.com/default-help/.

This field sets the URL for the Terms of Use of a self-hosted site. A link to the terms appears at the bottom of the sign-up and login pages. Default value is https://about.mattermost.com/default-terms/.

This field sets the URL for the Privacy Policy of a self-hosted site. A link to the policy appears at the bottom of the sign-up and login pages. Default value is https://about.mattermost.com/default-privacy-policy/.

This field sets the URL for a page containing general information about a self-hosted site. A link to the About page appears at the bottom of the sign-up and login pages. Default value is https://about.mattermost.com/default-about/.
Set a custom URL for the Forgot Password link on the Mattermost login page. Leave this field blank to use Mattermost's Password Reset workflow.
This field sets the URL for the Report a Problem link in the channel header Help menu. Default value is https://about.mattermost.com/default-report-a-problem.
This field sets the URL for the Download Apps link in the Product menu. Default value is https://about.mattermost.com/downloads/.
This field sets the URL to download the Mattermost Android app. Default value is https://about.mattermost.com/mattermost-android-app/.
This field sets the URL to download the Mattermost iOS app. Default value is https://about.mattermost.com/mattermost-ios-app/.
The default language for system messages and logs. Default value is en.
The default language for new users and pages where the user isn't logged in. Default value is en.
Sets the list of languages users see under Settings > Display > Language. Default is en.

displayname: Max users per team (Users and teams)
description: The maximum total number of users per team, including active and inactive users. Default is 50 users per team.

displayname: Max channels per team (Users and teams)
description: The maximum number of channels per team, including both active and archived channels. Default is 2000 channels per team.

displayname: Enable users to open direct message channels with (Users and teams)
description:
This setting determines whether a user can open a direct message channel with anyone on the Mattermost server or only to members of the same team.

  • Any user on the Mattermost server: (Default) Users can send a direct message to any user through the Direct Messages > More menu. config.json setting: "any"
  • Any member of the team: The Direct Messages > More menu only allows direct messages to users on the same team. config.json setting: "team"

This setting determines how names appear in posts and under the Direct Messages list.

  • Show username: (Default) Displays usernames. config.json option: "username".
  • Show nickname if one exists...: Displays the user’s nickname. config.json option: "nickname_full_name".
  • Show first and last name: Displays the user’s full name. config.json option: "full_name".

displayname: Lock teammate name display for all users (Users and teams)
description:
This setting controls whether users can change settings under Settings > Display > Teammate Name Display.

  • true: Users cannot change the Teammate Name Display.
  • false: (Default) Users can change the Teammate Name Display setting.

displayname: Allow users to view archived channels
description:
• true: (Default) Allows users to access the content of archived channels of which they were a member.
  • false: Users are unable to access content in archived channels.

• true: (Default) All users can see the email addresses of every other user.
  • false: Hides email addresses in the client user interface, except for System Admins and the System Roles with read/write access to Compliance, Billing, or User Management (users/teams/channels/groups etc).

• true: (Default) Full names are visible to all users in the client user interface.
  • false: Hides full names from all users, except System Admins.

displayname: Enable custom user statuses (Users and teams)
description:
• true: (Default) Users can set status messages and emojis that are visible to all users.
  • false: Users cannot set custom statuses.

displayname: Enable last active time (Users and teams)
description:
• true: (Default) Users can see when inactive users were last active on a user's profile and in direct message channel headers.
  • false: Users can't see when inactive users were last online.

displayname: Enable custom user groups (Users and teams)
description:
• true: (Default) Users with appropriate permissions can create custom user groups, and users can @mention custom user groups in Mattermost conversations.
  • false: Users cannot set custom statuses.

• true: (Default) Requires users to confirm when posting @channel, @all, @here, or group mentions in channels with more than 5 members.
  • false: No confirmation is required.

• true: (Default) Enables automatic email notifications for posts.
  • false: Disables notifications.

• true: (Default) When Send email notifications is false, users see the Preview Mode banner.
  • false: Preview Mode banner does not appear.

• true: Multiple email notifications for mentions and direct messages over a given time period are batched into a single email.
  • false: (Default) Emails will be sent for each mention or direct message.

• Send full message contents: (Default) Email notifications include the full message contents, along with the name of the sender and the channel. config.json setting: "full"
  • Send generic description with only sender name: Only the name of the sender and team name are included in email notifications. config.json setting: "generic"
Display name for email notifications sent from the Mattermost system.
Email address for notification emails from the Mattermost system. Default value is test@example.com.
Sets a user support (or feedback) email address that is displayed on email notifications and during the Getting Started tutorial.
Email address used in the reply-to header when sending notification emails from the Mattermost system. Default value is test@example.com.
Optional setting to include the organization’s name and mailing address in the footer of email notifications.

• Generic description with only sender name: Push notifications include the sender’s name, but not the channel name or message contents. config.json setting: "generic_no_channel"
  • Generic description with sender and channel names: (Default) Push notifications include the name of the sender and channel, but not the message contents. config.json setting: "generic"
  • Full message content sent in the notification payload: Includes the message contents in the push notification payload. config.json setting: "full"
  • Full message content fetched from the server on receipt (Available in Mattermost Enterprise): The notification payload contains no message content; the content is fetched separately. config.json setting: "id_loaded"

• true: Enable an announcement banner that is displayed across the top of the screen for all teams.
  • false: (Default) Disable the announcement banner.
The text of the announcement banner.
The background color of the announcement banner. Default value is #f2a93b.
The color of the text in the announcement banner. Default value is #333333.

• true: (Default) Users can dismiss the banner. The banner will re-appear the next time the user logs in.
  • false: Users cannot dismiss the banner.

• true: (Default) Enables an emoji picker when composing messages and for message reactions.
  • false: Disables the emoji picker in message composition and reactions.

• true: Allows users to add emojis through a Custom Emoji option in the emoji picker.
  • false: (Default) Disables custom emojis.

• true: (Default) Enables automatic following for all threads that a user starts, or in which the user participates or is mentioned.
  • false: Disables automatic following of threads.

• Always On: (Default) Enables Collapsed Reply Threads on the server and for all users. config.json setting: "always_on"
  • Default On: Enables Collapsed Reply Threads on the server and for all users. config.json setting: "default_on"
  • Default Off: Enables Collapsed Reply Threads on the server but not for users. config.json setting: "default_off"
  • Disabled: Users cannot enable Collapsed Reply Threads. config.json setting: "disabled"

• true: (Default) Enables message priority for all users.
  • false: Disables the ability to set message priority and request acknowlegements.

• true: (Default) Users can trigger repeating notifications to mentioned recipients of urgent messages.
  • false: Disables the ability to send repeating notifications.

displayname: Maximum number of recipients for persistent notifications (Posts)
description: The maximum number of recipients users may send persistent notifications to. Default is 5.
The number of minutes between repeated notifications for urgent messages sent with persistent notifications. Default is 5.

displayname: Total number of persistent notifications per post (Posts)
description: The maximum number of times users may receive persistent notifications. Default is 6.

• true: The server generates a preview of the first website, image, or YouTube video linked in a message.
  • false: (Default) All previews are disabled and the server does not request metadata for any links contained in messages.

displayname: Disable link previews for specific domains (Posts)
description: Use this setting to disable previews of links for specific domains.

• true: (Default) Share links to Mattermost messages will generate a preview for any users that have access to the original message.
  • false: Share links do not generate a preview.

• true: Enables previews of SVG files attached to messages.
  • false: (Default) Disables previews of SVG files.

• true: Enables rendering of LaTeX in code blocks.
  • false: (Default) Disables rendering in blocks. Instead, LaTeX code is highlighted.

• true: (Default) Enables rendering of LaTeX in message text.
  • false: Disables inline rendering of LaTeX. Instead, LaTeX in message text is highlighted.
A list of URL schemes that will automatically create a link in message text.
If a key is provided in this setting, Mattermost displays titles of embedded YouTube videos and detects if a video is no longer available.

displayname: Enable server syncing of message drafts (Posts)
description: Enable or disable the ability to synchronize draft messages across all supported Mattermost clients.

systemconsole: Site Configuration > File Sharing and Downloads
description:
• true: (Default) Allows users to attach files to messages.
  • false: Prevents users from attaching files (including images) to a message.

displayname: Allow file uploads on mobile (File sharing)
systemconsole: Site Configuration > File Sharing and Downloads
description:
• true: (Default) Allows users to attach files to messages from mobile apps.
  • false: Prevents users from attaching files (including images) to messages from mobile apps.

displayname: Allow file downloads on mobile (File sharing)
systemconsole: Site Configuration > File sharing and downloads
description:
• true: (Default) Enables file downloads on mobile apps.
  • false: Disables file downloads on mobile apps. Users can still download files from a mobile web browser.

• true: Allows users to create public links to files attached to Mattermost messages.
  • false: (Default) Prevents users from creating public links to files and disables all previously created links.
32-character salt added to the URL of public file links. Changing this setting will invalidate all previously generated links.

• true: (Default) System Admins will receive in-product notices about server upgrades and administration features.
  • false: System Admins will not receive specific notices. Admins will still receive notices for all users (see Enable end user notices).

• true: (Default) All users receive in-product notices about client upgrades and end user features.
  • false: Users will not receive in-product notices.
